ARTICLE.TITLE: The man who wrote the story of how Bethlehem got its name on Christmas Eve
ARTICLE.TEXT: While inspired by Christmas Eve, there were other reasons Count Nicholas Ludwig von Zinzendorf might have given the new Moravian settlement the name Bethlehem. In Hebrew, Bethlehem means "house of bread." An American Indian name for Lehigh is Lecha, which is similar to lechem. Some historians believe that Zinzendorf may have wanted to add another layer of meaning beyond the biblical reference: House (Beth) on the Lehigh (Lechem). It forms a Hebrew-American Indian compound. The Moravians would go on to minister to Indians, setting up the Nain village in what is now west Bethlehem.
